intro: Eriocaulon nitens, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Eriocaulaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in wetland and marshy habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered spikelets that bear tiny flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often forming dense mats that help stabilize aquatic environments. Eriocaulon nitens plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small aquatic life.
